diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +59,63 @@                rel_path = os.path.relpath(local_dir, root)
                rel_path = relative_path_to_artifact_path(rel_path)
                upload_path = posixpath.join(dest_path, rel_path)
            for f in filenames:
                path = posixpath.join(upload_path, f)

comments.body:
Yes, this seems safe based on the following logic:

`root` is a subdirectory of `local_dir`. Therefore, `get_relative_path(local_dir, root)` first finds the common prefix of `root` and `local_dir`, which is `local_dir`. `get_relative_path()` then returns `os.path.relpath(root, commonprefix)`. Because `commonprefix = local_dir`, we have that `get_relative_path(local_dir, root) == os.relpath(root, local_dir)`.
